item.description:
Providence is celebrating its 375th Birthday down on the newly renovated PPAC Square on Weybosset Street.  In brevity, the event will consist of the following:

  • Musical Performances
  • Birthday Cake Competition
  • Food Truck Faceoff
  • Art Exhibits
  • Fireworks at 6 pm (this is why we're meeting up @ 5 pm)

I'll be down by the food truck competition at 5 pm, namely close to the Poco Loco Taco Truck.  Should be sporting a blue-and-white "Cat in the Hat" type hat to help you guys all find me.  Not sure how recognizable I'll be in the dark, but the PPAC square is pretty well lit.

The Providence 375th Birthday bash has been somewhat poorly planned.  Not even the representatives at the PPAC box office know what is going on specifically, only that you only need to purchase tickets if you plan on going inside the PPAC (tickets for $13.75 are all that remain ... http://www.ppacri.org/events/detail/providence-375-birthday-bash). ;

All public access areas, such as the food truck competition, and fireworks at 6 pm, are open to the public and you do NOT need to purchase tickets.  Any thing that is happening on the Weybosset Square outside the PPAC will be open to the public. 

My main focus is upon the food trucks and sampling some really good food that the city has to offer, birthday cake as well if possible.

Hope this information clarifies any confusion on my part.  I look forward to seeing you all there!

 

Thanks to Matt from "Newcomers to the Providence Area" for allowing me to repost the musical line-ups.

Weybosset Street Sidewalk
6:00 PM: Fireworks display
5-10:00 PM: Food Truck Face Off
5:30-7:30 PM: Providence's Dancing Cop
5:30-6:00 PM and 6:15-6:45 PM:  Extraordinary Rendition Band
6-10:00 PM: Gather Glass

Main Stage  6:30 PM: The Barr Brothers

7:30 PM: Christopher Johnson
Join Mayor Taveras in singing Happy Birthday to the City!
Results of The Official Providence 375 Bakery Competition
7:45 PM: Jeffrey Osborne
8:00 PM: Deer Tick
9:00 PM: The Minsky Sisters
9:15 PM: Area 401

Lobby Lounge
6:00 PM: Hear in Rhode Island and the Rhode Island Songwriters Association (Billy Mitchell, W.S. Monroe, Heather Rose, John Fuzek, Indigo Bethea, Dean Petrella and Buddy Cavaleri)
7:45 PM: Kim Thomas Band
8:45 PM: The 'Mericans

Box Office Lobby
6:00-9:00 PM:
On exhibit: Hope, Roots, Freedom, and Ingenuity: A Community History Project presented by Providence City Archives and The History of the Providence Fire Department

Lobby
6:00-10:00 PM:
Local bakeries compete for the honor of becoming the Official Providence 375 Bakery | AS220's Photographic Memory | Trivia created by the Rhode Island Historical Society | Multicultural Performances
item.how_to_find_us: I'll be sporting a blue-and-white "Cat in the Hat" hat ... and I'll keep it close to the food trucks
item.name: CHEAP EATS: Food Truck Face-off and Prov 375th B-Day Bash
